Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: vdg721
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast. Close to Little Italy. Heard the train horns but slept great because we were so tired. Like that there were 2 tvs. Housekeeping service was great. Would stay in the future. If you are disable, bring the placard. We were comped for free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Monica F
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms. Staff friendly/helpful. Worst I can say is the eggs are not so good at the FREE breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Hate to Write Bad Review!”
Reviews.Author: CDMDJD
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I traveled from LA to San Diego with my 90 year old Mother and Sister. The hotel desk staff could not have been friendlier. Check-in was no longer than 2 minutes. All the pictures you see online are very close to the look and feel of this location. The only handicap room available was located on the first floor and at the back of the hotel. Breakfast was great! All food was either hot or cold as appropriate. Prior to night coming, I would give this location a 10. With all that said, here comes the bad news! The hotel backs to both the train and trolly tracks! Readers take heed, this hotel could not have a nicer staff, cleaner facility or be more accomodating... but if you are needing a good nights sleep... that will just not happen. Yes the front desk staff tried their best to be comforting such as providing as many ear plugs as needed. But that just was not enough. Every 10 to 30 minutes some sort of train or trolly came by. What do I mean some sort of train? There were a variety of forms such as Metro line, Amtrack and the worst culprit, the working trains. Metro and Amtrack stopped sometime near 11 PM, but the cargo trains work all night. The final straw was when I woke to the room trembling. I yelled "Earthquake" then as the trembling stopped, the rumbling began and I yelled "Tornado" but then remembered oh we are in San Diego, then don't have tornados. Just about that time and RIGHT IN FRONT OF OUR HOTEL WINDOW, the train whistles began. What time did all this happen? 2:30 AM! No getting back to sleep for us and all this with a full day of work ahead of us. I went to the front desk and notified them about this at 3:00 am. They were gracious and attempted to find a different room for the next night, but also stated the entire hotel can hear and feel the trains. When I said that would not do, they offered to call a different Residence Inn. They did, and found us a perfect one, quite and we left later in the morning. All in all over the top in nice people, way below in ability to get rest. TOO BAD AS THIS COULD HAVE BEEN THE PERFECT PLACE, LOCATION.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Train too noisy”
Reviews.Author: Angela D
Reviews.Content: Great friendly check in counter staff. Clean hotel. A little more dated than other Residence Inns I have stayed at. Bed was very hard. Good free breakfast. We had a room at the back of the building and the train noise was horrible! Could have gotten use to the clickity clack of just the train but they had to keep blowing their horns as they passed by us. I didn't get much sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location, and great service!”
Reviews.Author: CompuDoc
Reviews.Content: We loved our experience and stay at this facility. Everything, from breakfast to accommodations to location, were perfect. And just when we thought we had experienced perfection, I realized several days later that I left a battery charger for my camera in the hotel room. Ivan at the hotel did a great job tracking it down, giving me calls to keep me updated on his progress. And to my surprise, he apologized to me for the few days that it took to find it and he offered to ship it to me for free. Now that's great service!

Reviews.Title: “Good people ok location”
Reviews.Author: keith j
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the airport and the breakfast is good. The employees are very nice and rooms are good. However the train can be annoying as others have said. It is close to little italy and the local train stop is convenient. The problem with the train is that amtrak and freight train use same tracks that rub behind hotel. Ask for room closer to front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget stay in downtown San Diego, exceptional staff!”
Reviews.Author: tolew
Reviews.Content: Our group of six stayed in a suite while attending a conference. The room was clean, spacious, and easily suited our larger group. There were two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a pull-out bed in the living room. The complimentary breakfast in the morning was above average and hot portion (e.g., eggs, fried potatoes) especially good. The hotel is next to Little Italy and a 30 minute walk (or $10 cab) to the gaslamp area and the convention center. As others have mentioned, it's near trains but they didn't keep us awake or anything. All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. We had three surprises that were bad, good, and neutral: 1. The hotel website lists a manager's reception but it's actually only Monday to Wednesday. This was a disappointment because (in part) we chose the hotel because of that. Staying Wed-Sun meant we missed it. 2. A welcome surprise was the hotel's free shuttle that will take you anywhere within three miles and pick you up too. The drivers were friendly and prompt. This saved us a lot of cab money and certainly made up for item #1. A very special thanks to the front desk staff and shuttle driver who were working the morning of January 29, who retrieved a lost cell phone from our room and shuttled it to the airport. Above and beyond! 3. I asked the front desk to call a taxi, but after getting in the car we realized it was actually much more expensive than a normal cab ($35 to the beach vs. a $20 taxi ride home). When we complained to the front desk (i.e., we had asked for a normal taxi not a luxury car) they said the hotel was trying out a new cab service that claims "luxury cabs at regular taxi prices" but they were quickly finding out that claim wasn't true. So, the hotel refunded the difference in fares! Great customer service there, and special thanks to Ian at the front desk who took my complaint and was very understanding. (I suspect the hotel will not be using that company for much longer.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: malhot123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights on Dec 26th and 27th. First the positives, and why I say Great: 1) This hotel has great staff and a special thanks to Ian at the front desk. he was wonderful- extremely attentive to detail- went out of his way to try and arrange a big rental car for us- since we were 8 people 2) It is right next to Little Italy - so great eating options right there 3) It is not very far from Seaport, Gaslamp and the airport- so high on the convenience factor 4) They offer a free shuttle- which is excellent and prompt Decent: 1) this is by no means a 4 or 5 star hotel- hence amenities and rooms are as per a 3 star range 2) Most residence Inn's I have stayed at are certainly more spacious- so in this ones it fell a tad bit short 3) Rooms are nice/ decent. Not too big- even though they have a separate living and bed room- they are tiny. Just enough for 4 of us (2 adult two small kids) 4) right next to railway track But overall- for the price and location- it was good

Reviews.Title: “4 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: sassiemama
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in November 2011. We like the location because we like to walk to Seaport Village and down by the boats. We stayed in the front of the building on the second floor. I don't recommend that. While we loved the space in the room, the view was blocked by trees and every morning at 6 am, you hear the noise down in the lobby as staff is preparing the breakfast and the noise from the street. They are building something across the street from it a park or something so they had construction equipment going. Breakfast is good wide variety of food and that saves some money. Staff was very nice, friendly and helpful. Didn't use the pool because it was chilly and rainy. Exercise room was very small and had older equipment. $14 to park is just too excessive in my opinion for outside parking. Good Location to the downtown area and very clean. Nice out door area but very small. There is a fire pit comfortable seating and barbecue grills to use. Cost for 4 nights using a AAA rate was $700.

Reviews.Title: “Word of advice from Harold1966”
Reviews.Author: Harold1966
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this fantastic hotel in October 2010(I know that this review will say 2011, but there was no selection for Oct.2010. I have to say this-all of the people complaining about the noise from the trains are not worth considering. Unless you don't have access to a map, there are multiple train tracks right behind it. What did you expect? Sure it's loud, but you get used to it, and the fact that the train tracks are right by the hotel are not hidden from you! I had great service from the staff. If you get good or bad service from this or any other hotel, by all means leave a comment, but complaining about the noise is pointless with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: carrie g
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 14 month old son for a 5 night vacation. From check-in to check-out our entire experience was wonderful. The suite we stayed in had a full kitchen, which helps save money for that length of a trip. The continental breakfast they offer is amazing, not juice juice and cereal, but full on breakfast offerings including eggs, sausaage, waffle bar and all of this is included in the stay. The staff were very nice, and accomodating. The on-site washing machine and dryer came in handy. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the San Diego area, and we really can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “All fine, except train noise”
Reviews.Author: ranles76
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a freebie. Room 407, 1 bd suite with kitcheon. Really tight, but has everything. Breakfast has great variety. Managers reception, some nights, cheap wine and beer, hot dogs and burgers all free. Parking $14. Mostly blue jean working people. We used for base to go to the zoo and then old town. We live within 30 miles.

Reviews.Title: “Train tracks behind hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lr0che
Reviews.Content: Nice clean accommodations. Small bathroom. Close to airport. Only drawback was the train blew its horn and the train tracks are behind hotel and it woke us every time it went by and blew its horn. Parking is $14 a day, and we had no parking available, but they did comp the parking when we told them. I would personally not stay here again. Not after flying for six hours. Bed was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Front Desk staff”
Reviews.Author: snoopymaryland
Reviews.Content: Nice suites with full kitchens and lots of room. Clean and tidy. Front desk staff was exceptional...knowledgeable and very pleasant regardless of time of day. The only con was what seemed like an old mattress that wasn't terribly comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice For An Extended Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFra
Reviews.Content: We found this to be a decent place for an extended stay. It was within walking distance to several attractions and also offered a complimentary ride back from the zoo. No room service but a free buffet in the evening. Rooms were apartment like with daily cleaning upon request.

Reviews.Title: “RI Right by the Waterfront”
Reviews.Author: JKHuddy
Reviews.Content: The good things: walk across Pacific Highway and a parking lot to the heart of San Diego's interesting waterfront. Close to the trolley (but see note below). Oh yea, friendly staff at check in and close to SAN with a shuttle that starts at 6 am. Can't think of anything else. The not so good things: although this is a Residence Inn, you are not getting the standard, spacious room layout. My room abutted a very active rail (Amtrak, the Trolley, etc.) which reminded me of a scene from "My Cousin Vinny". In truth, the trains seemed to stop running late a night, so I really didn't lose any sleep and I was up early to catch a flight, so that wasn't an issue. If you're a light sleeper or want to sleep in, this could be an issue. There is a charge for parking ($14/night) and the lot is tight. Small bathroom. Not inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: suegalway
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the Residence Inn for one night but it was in a great location for exploring San Diego's Gaslamp Quarter. Room was big and bright and we had a complimentary breakfast in the morning (nice touch). We sat outside in the courtyard to eat breakfast and it was all very relaxing after a long trip from San Francisco via Arcata, Yosemite, Sacramento and Santa Monica over the previous week.

Reviews.Title: “A second home”
Reviews.Author: Miahmouse
Reviews.Content: Stay at a place long enough and it begins to feel like a second home. Leaving work you may find yourself saying "I'm heading home" when actually you're just heading back to a hotel. The friendly nature of the staff at this establishment create this atmosphere, its convenient location solidifies it as the place I try first when staying in San Diego. Multiple nearby bars and restaurants + Courtesy shuttle to gas lamp/old town + Trolley stop 1 block away + Good walking/running trail nearby (by the water) +

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay”
Reviews.Author: twohappytravelers
Reviews.Content: We are staying at Residence Inn, Downtown San Diego. The hotel and staff have been nice enough with our limited exposure to them. The breakfast is typical for this kind of hotel. It is only open until 9:00 a.m. so if you are late sleeper, don't expect to see it because they clear it out on the minute. We did not use the pool but it looked clean and there were people out there. Our room faced the town and right behind our hotel is the railroad train which goes by all night long. We can hear it as well as the planes flying over head landing and taking off from the airport.. The entire hotel needs refurbishing including the Marriott promise of upgrading all of their mattresses. This one was certainly not an upgrade. We had our 10 year old with us and he is sleeping on the hide a bed which also needs to be upgraded. Generally they leave it open and made up but tonight it was closed with no sheets on it so we had to make the bed ourselves for him. It must be weekend staffing. There is a good wifi in the room which is free. The bedroom has queen sizes beds. I don't think they have king sized beds at this hotel property. The bathroom is okay with a tub shower. All in all, it is a place to stay, but not that exciting with all of the choices in San Diego. We are only here because we are using points.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding affordable choice for extended stay business travelers or families”
Reviews.Author: easystreets1
Reviews.Content: Large, comfortable rooms with free internet and kitchenettes. Breakfast included. Excellent service - I used the laundry service, hotel restaurant, lobby facilities, and breakfast room - all were well above average.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comforatable with Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Jmast7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the ADA meeting in June 2011. Despite the fact it was about a 25 minute walk from the Convention Center, I had an excellent stay. My room was large and comfortable with a full kitchen and wi-fi. The breakfast every morning was excellent - never had to purchase it myself and I was even able to take some fruit and granola bars for snacks during the meeting. Even though the location wasn't perfect in relation to the meeting, it was nice that it's located a block from the waterfront (including the Maritime Museum) and I ran along the very nice waterfront path a couple days I was there.The staff was very courteous and friendly too. Overall, a great place to stay for either business or pleasure and the price was excellent. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Wilson60
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel and the staff are very kind and helpul. When i arrived I requested a room change as I was overlooking the parking lot and preferred the pool. The front desk staff (Amanda and others) were very helpful and found me an excellent room overlooking the pool area which is really lovely. On my first night, the light above the balcony was extremely bothersome, shining into the room, making me think it was daytime. The second night I asked where the switch was to turn it off, and found out there was no switch-they had to send someone from maintenance to unscrew the bulb! The maintenance man, Jorge Cardenas was so nice and took care of everything. I am usually pretty laid back about hotel rooms, but the light was very annoying. Overall, this hotel is very clean and the rooms are nice and spacious. I am attending a conference at the Convention Center, so the location is not that great, with a 1.6 mile walk. But the walk is doable and the weather here is truly awesome. I would stay here again because the staff really seem to care, and everything is clean and freshl, and the rooms are very spacioius and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “My best hotel stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Henrysworld
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Residence Inn was very delightful. My wife and i enjoyed the hotel experience more than the attractions the city had to offer. The hotel was very accommodating, our stay at the Residence Inn exceeded our exspectations by far than any we had exspected.The staff were exceptionally nice, friendly, curteous, and very proficient at their job. The employees that i would like to extend my appreciation to are, the shuttle driver Mr Gerardo his knowlege of the city was really helpful and Vance, Sidney, Amanda, Marj collectively are responsible for our delightful stay. The professionalism of these valued employees will keep my wife and I returning for future stays, thank you all once again for a wonderful experience. Henry & Tina Jones

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in heart of downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kdeogburn
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews I read on trip advisor. I wasn't disappointed, the hotel met and exceeded my expectations. I booked a 2 bedroom/2 bath suite for me and my parents. We arrived on a Saturday to spend a couple days in San Diego before we left on a Tuesday to do a 10 night cruise leaving from San Diego and ending in Vancouver. The staff was very friendly, the free breakfast was probably the best out of all the hotels I've stayed at (nice array of multiple breakfast items...almost as good as the buffet on the cruise). The hotel was only a mile from the cruise terminal and was very convenient to walk around to the various shops and restaurants nearby. The hotel has a free shuttle bus that would take you to places such as the zoo (which we did) and even dropped us off at the cruise terminal (it was close enough to walk but was nice that we didn't have to drag our luggage with us). Their is a train that runs behind the hotel (heard it whistling but it didn't keep me up at night based on what I read in other peoples reviews). We paid $269.00 per night which I thought was a good deal (considering we basically had a 2 bedroom apt with a kitchen and free shuttle that saved us from having to rent a car). Overall, if I return to San Diego in the future I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Bday Party”
Reviews.Author: SDFrank51
Reviews.Content: Great staff! Friendly and very attentive. Knowledgeable of the area and had good recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer Service”
Reviews.Author: nandos678
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with hotel staff, especially, Parnia and Ryoma in the breakfast room. What a great attitude exhibited with a great smiling faces? Both did everything way above and beyond to please my family and me. We will definitely be back next time.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel staff was the friendliest and most courteous ever.”
Reviews.Author: billyfromphilly1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because they offered a shuttle and the front desk and the shuttle drivers made us feel like we never put them out and were just so awesome and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely enjoyed my stay & will stay here everytime we return to San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: Lonna4car24
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with our room and with the staff here. From the front desk to housekeeping, the staff was so pleasant, friendly, helpful and very accomodating. They made our stay here feel like home. Special thanks to Vance, Marg & Ivan at the front desk, who always made me feel welcome & special, even when I lost my room key. Another special thanks to our shuttle driver, Gerardo, who made our evenings even better by providing us pleasant & safe transportation. Gerardo also ofered ice & water to those at the pool on hot days when it was definitely needed & much appreciated! Another special thanks to the maintence guy who always had a smile on his face & a kind word to say to all. He also promptly fixed the whirlpool when it was down, which made myself & other guests very happy. The rooms were very nice, comfortable, roomy & clean. Also, a plus is that you allow pets. Its so difficult to find pet friendly hotels these days. Although I didnt bring my pets on this trip, its nice to know I can! The only suggestion I have would be to offer king size beds & ceiling fans in some rooms. It was hard to sleep comfortably with my fiance in our bed. Just wasnt enough room to stretch out. Also, some people, such as myself, like to sleep with a fan on. So I was very impressed that when I asked if a fan was available, one was promptly brought to my room! What great customer service! Other than that, our stay was the best I've had in yrs! Service like this is hard to find. So we will definitely stay here everytime we're in town, which is often, due to his work. Thanks again for such a pleasant stay! Looking foward to staying here again next month!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff in a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Harold1966
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose to stay there for 19 days for our first big trip together. Sure it's near the trains and the airport, but we got used to it right away. The staff was exceptionally helpful, and the shuttle service was a plus, particularily to Ralph's! We reserved a room with a kitchenette, which saved us a lot of money, and made it seem like home. Also, our room had a separate bedroom from the living room, each having it's own tv, which was a thoughtful touch. Hats off to Rudy and the rest of the staff and management for giving our vacation that special touch that I'll never forget. We will be back(in the same room!).

Reviews.Title: “Good value, Good location as far as area, but location comes with...???”
Reviews.Author: trotter13
Reviews.Content: Train noise, Train whistles starting at 6 am. We are a deep sleepers but this hotel is very noisy, if you are a early riser this hotel might be okay if you want a value. Also the rooms are noisy because you can hear people above walking, flushing the toilet and also you can constantly smell other people's food seeping into your room. Also on sleep quality; the bed is a small queen size and very hard bed, therefore you'll wake up stiff and sore. Parking lot is very tight to maneuver your full size car. Got charged with food and drinks on our bill, never even when through the front door besides check in. Good points; close to downtown, airport, harbor, refrigerator, microwave, excellent TV's, fair size room, good customer service, good wireless free Internet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and value”
Reviews.Author: MadisonGibsonia
Reviews.Content: Spent few days in San Diego prior to cruise and enjoyed this hotel very much. The free breakfast was terrific and the free shuttle service that took us the dinner each night and the zoo on one of our days was simply fantastic. All of the staff was very helpful and room accommodations were terrific.

Reviews.Title: “A heartly recommend hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: RICARBSAS
Reviews.Content: This centrally located hotes is close to the bay and marina and three blocks to the trolley station "Little Italy" and 5 minutes to the San Diegos's downtown heart. The one bedroon suite is an oversized room with a lot of amenities: 2 flats, a fully equipated kitchen including fridge, micro, coffee maker. A big sofabed at the living room and a desk for bussiness work with high speed wi fi internett access. The queen bed is very comfortable and the hole suite is very clean. The hotel amenities includes a heated pool (not really heated), a jacuzzi and two barbecues, a complimentary shuttle to and from the airport and three miles around the hotel. The hot buffet breakfast is very complete and some days the "social hour" from 5.30 to 7.30 pm provide complimentary hot food and beverages including wines and beers. The entire staff is very helpful. This is a heartly recommend hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TRaveLDivA36
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprized with this hotel...my suite was comprised of two large rooms, both with flat screen TVs, full kitchen, large bathroom with walk in shower. The living room had a comfortable couch from which to watch tv-it felt like a small but well appointed apartment, right in the heart of San Diego, a couple of blocks from the Gaslamp District, where all the good restaurants, stores, bars/nightlife happens. Unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to play, but would go again and definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest hotel in 43 years of treavelling!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sleepless60805
Reviews.Content: If you like airplane noise that literally shakes your room and sets off car alarms, if you like a train 10 feet from the back of your building that blows it's horn everytime it passes all night long, if you like road noise and fog horns in the middle of the night, this is just the hotel for you. Literally there is not a QUIET room in the whole place. Having a bed in this place is akin to false advertising because it implies you may sleep there. I assure you, unless you are deaf, drunk or near dead you will not sleep at this hotel. Staff is wonderful, but who cares after 2 nights with about 1 hour of total sleep. Avoid like the plague!

Reviews.Title: “faded glory”
Reviews.Author: ishkabibl
Reviews.Content: Nice try but this place is an embarrassment to Marriott Happy Hour, a nice touch, consisted of the cheapest hot dogs and hamburgers. If you are going to do something nice, like has appetizers, don't undo the goodwill by serving crap. My room reminded me of a cheap motel. Lamp did not work and neither did the hard wire for the internet The free shuttle bus to the airport does not start running early enough to make the first flights of the day, which is ironic given that this dump's location to the airport is its selling point. On the other hand, the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: goadventure
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to downtown, right off main highway to other attractions, great dining options, so close to airport but no noisy plane issues while in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: babygirl96
Reviews.Content: My Daughter loves hotels, we have stayed in alot of hotels, and this one by far was the best hotel, the rooms were huge, the bathrooms were very nice, the ktchen is stocked with all the that you would need if you wanted to cook or bring stuff for the kids to snack on. The staff are over the top nice, the breakfast the next morning was SOOOOOO good, and the pool and the fire pit is very nice and realxing, they have a bbq outside if you want bbq at the pool. Such a great weekend !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Staff made our trip wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MimiTennessee
Reviews.Content: Loved the location! The whistles from the near-by passing trains never bothered us,..maybe that's because we always travel with a 'noise filtering machine'. We loved the shuttle service..always ready and available to take us places,..including to and from the airport. Cannot say enough about the kindness shown to us by two of the shuttle drivers...Maribel and Gerardo. Thank you both for always leaving us with a smile on our faces..YOU TWO ARE THE BEST. We four "girlfriends" had the most fun ever on our annual Christmas trip...not only was the city great,.. but you two always made us feel so special! THANKS!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Residence Inn near little italy”
Reviews.Author: palmtree34
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel and we had a party of 5. We have never stayed at a Residence Inn as usually stay at Hilton Homewood suites. This was a return trip to SD and since this location was closer to downtown with restaurants and attraction then our previous stay at Homewood in Liberty Station we decided to give it a try. We were very impressed with the size of the 2 bedroom suite. Full kitchen and 2 bathrooms. We booked in advance and requested a room not facing the train tracks and we did get this. We did not hear any noise in our rooms of trains. The staff were very friendly and helpfull. Complimentary breakfast daily and light dinners mon-thurs were quite a treat.(beer and wine included) They had a cozy fireplace by the pool where you could relax. WE had the pool to ourselves as no one else was using it on the nights we were there. The trains do come by behind the pool and we sure got a chuckle of the noise it was like a movie lol What we really liked about this hotel is they offer a free shuttle within 3 miles of the hotel. We could leave our car behind and avoid finding locations or parking. Every afternoon they had fresh baked cookies at the front desk for guests. The shuttle drivers were very friendly (Mark and Gerardo) who made our trip special. WE got a good rate by booking 8 mths in advance with AAA but If I had to pay $299 a night like some were I would be disappointed as this was too much for a hotel room. We would definatly return as the location suited us very well. The Saturday farmers market to walk to in Little Italy was fabulous. The trolley train is only a block away if you wanted to take it to go shopping or other attractions. One negative was that I saw a dog out on a balcony and if I had allergies I would be making sure I requested a room that is pet free! I dont know if they snuck this dog in or not as they were also smoking outside balcony and I thought most hotels were smoke free now.. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lackluster but Convenient to Airport”
Reviews.Author: Jim_in_Virginia
Reviews.Content: Very close to San Diego airport and downtown area, but located in a highly commercial-business area. Had all the expected advantages of a Residence Inn but was at the bare essentials level. There was a very nice market a short drive away. One downside was its proximity the main rail line. Definitely ask for a room at the front of the building, as it backs onto very active tracks. Also beware that they charge $12.00 a day for outside self-parking. The hotel and rooms were clean. The staff was friendly. We stayed on Marriott points and Marriott rated it a Category 5. That's a bit of a stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: JayD2006
Reviews.Content: I would describe this hotel just like any other residence inn but more cozy. The staff was fantastic from front desk to housekeeping, absolutely great service. Breakfast offered was buffet style with a variety of hot and cold items. The suite was of good size with 2 TV's and a separate sitting area and full kitchen. Yes the rail road track is just behind the hotel and can be for some little bit annoying. But personally I wasn't bother at all. The only thing that didn't make sense to me is that they charge for parking $12/day even though the hotel is located away from central downtown where parking is limited. Overall I liked this hotel and would recommend it to anyone visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Like a boutique hotel owned by family. I will be back”
Reviews.Author: BJHarroun
Reviews.Content: I will address the bad stuff right away. Yes, I saw the train. I was not bothered by it. Slept like a baby. My two one bedroom studio suites were cute as a button. I was in the front of the hotel. Color Scheme is Navy Blue and yellow. The staff was exemplary. My slightest wish was at my door in minutes. They were friendly and more than ready to help at the front desk. The free breakfast was very good, certain to please almost anyone. Some sugar-free yogurt would be nice. Snacks and drinks in the evening hit the spot. I really loved sitting by the firepit. I did not think it was the best location, but gave me a much bigger bang for my buck than a better located hotel would have. The harbor is only a block away for an evening walk. Little Italy is a few blocks on India Street. I had a rental car, but the shuttle will take you anywhere in a 3 mile range if you want to go that route. The trolley is close by. Parking is pretty tight and there is a charge.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: beadrbop
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our stay here. My son and I were there for Comic Con. We had been placed on a wait list for a hotel that was nonsmoking and this was the only that had any space. The room was spacious and very clean. The accommodations were as represented in the website photos. The staff was very nice and courteous and responded quickly to any of our requests. Unfortunately the hotel is close to the train route. I am a very light sleeper and have insomnia so it was near impossible for me to get any more than a few hours of sleep. The first few nights I heard the train at 6:19 am and then 20 minutes after that well in advance of when I really wanted to wake up. On Saturday night in addition to the 6:19 am noise from the train, I heard the train at around 1 am. So I can not in all honesty recommend this hotel to anyone who has any issues with noise for sleeping. Even my 11 year old son who is a very heavy sleeper woke up due to the noise. I would not have booked with them had I known about the proximity to the trains. Another issue was the lack of wifi access to the internet. (Not a big deal and they did have instructions on how to connect). One recommendation would be to also include instructions for Apple systems (instructions only were for Windows). The only option was to use a ibahn cord located on the desk. The internet connection was not high speed at all. The average download speed at best was around 0.58 Mb/s for download and average 0.40Mb/s upload speed. Since I was there for Comic Con to take photos for the TV panels it was almost impossible to get the images uploaded in a quick manner. I really wanted to love the place but the noise just was too much for us.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little surprises that rank this hotel above most in its class”
Reviews.Author: RonboNJ
Reviews.Content: So....do I have the first Comic-Con review? Yes, I am here in San Diego for Comic-Con. I am one of hundreds that stayed in this sold-out Residence Inn during Comic-Con 2010. While most will be basing their reviews on a $200+ per night room I am basing mine on a $149 per night room as I got in right before rates were raised. Most of you reading this review will be booking this hotel at the streamlined rate. I came into San Diego a day early and stayed one night at the Courtyard Marriot located across the harbor at the Airport/Liberty Station. It is a spectacular Marriot and you can read my review of it on TripAdvisor. I was very concerned when upon my second night in the city I came to the Residence Inn. It doesn't look nearly as nice from the outside, and when I saw an Amtrack train running directly behind it, I thought I was going to be miserable for the rest of the week. Looks can be deceiving. This was my first time at a Residence Inn so I didn't know quite what to expect. When I opened my room door, my jaw dropped. Here was what amounts to a mini apartment. You have a kitchen with microwave and refrigerator, a living room and a bedroom that is separated by a wall in some rooms, and in some others is not. I was fortunate to get a bedroom with a wall separation. Bed was very, very comfortable. I slept soundly. I have never been in a hotel room like this, and really, it's a wonderfully roomy little suite. Where this hotel really exceeds is the little extras that you get. In the morning there is a free hot breakfast that is quite good. There's eggs, breakfast potatoes, french toast or pancakes, oatmeal, waffles, muffins, cereal and doughnuts. There's coffee and a soda machine that also has apple and orange juice. It really is a nice little spread. On Mondays - Thursdays from 5:30-7:30pm there's free food in the lobby. I only was there one night during at that time and they were serving up hamburgers, hotdogs, beans, potato salad and potato chips. It was pretty much as much as you wanted though I am sure the hotel would appreciate no-one making a pig of themselves. Oh, did I mention there was free beer on tap as well? ...and, yes, free high-speed Internet in the rooms! The clerks as the front desk were always very friendly and helpful with our questions about the area. In fact, they were most helpful in holding a room for my colleagues and I as we got into town very early in the morning and were driving to LA. They blocked out three rooms for us and when we got back late that night those rooms were available to us. There is a nicely sized pool on the premises and a fire pit that is lit at night to provide warmth to the couch chairs that surround it. Very nice touch. Now here is the big question that all of you have on the forefront of your mind.... How bad is the train situation? The answer is, very bad. There is an Amtrack train and Trolley that runs seemingly non-stop directly behind the hotel. The Amtrack is blowing its horn throughout the day. At night the train seems to blow shorter/quicker horns in an effort to be less annoying at those hours, but it still must run its horn to warn anyone at the crossing gate nearby. To be honest, it never woke me. Then again, my room was the other side of the hotel. But you know what? It doesn't matter where in the hotel you are, the train is right there. If you slept during the day I could see the noise being a problem because it's like Grand Central Station behind the hotel. At night, not as busy. The hotel does supply you with a set of earphones. You can talk about how bad the train situation is at this hotel, but from all the reviews I read about the Hilton and the Marriott down by the Convention center, they both have the same train problems. In fact, it would be very hard to find a hotel close to the water that doesn't have train service nearby. If anyone looking to save a few bucks and stay at this hotel during a convention such as Comic-Con, I have great news for you. The Trolley station is right around the corner. The walk is under 5 minutes and you simply take the blue line to Americana Place and then switch to the Orange line to the convention center. During big events like Comic-Con there is express train service that goes directly to the convention center without transfers. So, all in all, I found this to be a wonderful hotel. I mean, you get free breakfast which is a real plus. Certainly, they don't have to put out free food in the evening...but they do. It's those little added touches that have already made up my mind that this will be the first place I look to book next year when I return to San Diego for Comic-Con 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Great family atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: mari042
Reviews.Content: The family had a great time!!! We were able to go to Disneyland and the Los Angeles fashion district from this location. Disneyland was only 1 and 1/2 hours away. We returned to the calm and beautiful city of San Diego. This Residence Inn is close to all the other locations we visited; the Harbor Excursion tours, fishing trips, Midway Ship, Star of India, downtown stores, Old Town, the Zoo, Balboa Park, Museums, restaurants, missions, etc. They provide breakfast and it gives you a good start for the day. A light dinner is also provided. The staff was friendly and helpful. An excellent place to stay and looking forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, not the best location - for heavy sleepers only”
Reviews.Author: ocInvestor2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an average Residence Inn in layout and amenities. Single suite rooms are a good size and the 2 bedroom suites are great for families - large and with a generously sized kitchen. The location by San Diego's cruise terminal, within a 15 minute walk of downtown and the Gaslamp Quarter and next to San Diego's Little Italy makes it a fine spot to explore San Diego's downtown core. The property has one huge plus and one huge minus. It is literally right next to a set of train tracks that carries frequent passengar and freight trains as well as San Diego's light rail trolley system. The train noise is bearable if you are in the front of the property. But if you get stuck in the back, overlooking the tracks, expect lots of noise and 2 or 3 large trains in the middle of the night which pass through with horns blaring due to the numerous road intersections they have to cross in the neighborhood. The huge plus is the staff, they are friendly, helpful. professional and courteous. One of the best crews I have run into at a mid-price hotel chain. I have used this property for both business and personal trips. All in all I reccomend it, but with the caveat that anyone contemplating staying here should know what the trade offs are with the train noise.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: dmbakerphd
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business convention in May. I spotted a rather large cockroach in the ground floor room I was given overlooking the pool. The presence of maintenance men outside my window was a little un-nerving as well. However, the staff quickly transferred me to a room on the fourth floor where I had much better luck. I do agree with those who commented on the trains going by, however I only heard the train in the family area, not in the bedroom. Therefore I was able to sleep. I also noticed a set of earplugs on the night stand which I thought was a nice touch. The continental breakfasts were acceptable, but I would have liked a bit more fresh fruit. It was a little more southwestern cuisine than I am used to. The happy hour meal was quite substantial as well, plus the rooms have a full kitchen which was nice for storing a few doggy bags. The hotel staff was very helpful and directed my to a trolly tour a few blocks away. In addition to providing shuttle service to and from the airport, they will also take you to and from the San Diego Zoo or Balboa park at designated times. They even picked me up at a hotel near the convention center after an evening dinner meeting. The location was close to the Marina district and little Italy. Other than that, there isn't alot around the area to see, but if you use the shuttle service you should be able to get so some of the major sites.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Great Option for Young Families”
Reviews.Author: dadofgirliegirls
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is great as long as you want nightlife and excitement. But for our family with young girls, it was not ideal. The rooms are a bit outdated and small, the area is not very pretty and worst of all, there's a train that goes by every half hour or so. After 2 days of poor sleeping, we moved out of this hotel and transferred to another Residence Inn in La Jolla - much more quiet and suited for our tastes. I think it could be a nice play to stay, but obviously not for our life stage.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: JimNielslen
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, heard the trains pass by right outside the window every 30 minutes, staff uninterested in bringing enough towels for three people - had to go wait them out. For $169 a night, I expected much, much better.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: eclecticgeek
Reviews.Content: The rooms are like cozy studio apartments. Steps away from the Boardwalk and the train. Free continental breakfast and snacks at night. Only downfall is close proximity to the Amtrak train tracks.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in downtown San Diego -- good pre-cruise option”
Reviews.Author: LuxNomadTraveler
Reviews.Content: We looked at a number of $300+ dollar options for San Diego to stay in the Gaslamp area. Now having seen the Gaslamp area, I was just as happy walking to the area & saving 50%. There is definitely a train noise issue -- it is not a train in the distance but it did not bother us. The service was great and with free Wi-Fi, free shuttle to/from airport as well as to the cruise terminal it was just a great value for a place to sleep while sightseeing or a short stop before heading to a cruise. Also free breakfast was nice benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: smitty87114
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location but will note that it is right by the train tracks and close to airport which you do hear flights and can really hear the train, however keep in mind train traffic stops at about 10:30 pm and then air traffic. there after. But great service, great product and good value

Reviews.Title: “Hope you like trains.....”
Reviews.Author: HCRC
Reviews.Content: You know you're in trouble when you check in and there are already ear plugs left at your bedside. I stay in a variety of Marriotts more than 100 nights per year and have never seen hotel-supplied earplugs at your bedside before. One night here and you'll know why. Trains pass at all hours of the day and night. If you just HAVE to stay here then request a room that faces the street - it'll be much quieter than any of the other rooms. Otherwise, friendly staff, clean rooms, the usual MR RI experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Shellhead
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited San Diego for a convention that I was attending. We were a bit apprehensive about staying there due to the negative reviews regarding noise from the trolleys and trains. We're glad that we didn't listen to those reviewers and decide to stay elsewhere. The noise was never really a factor and the customer service was OUTSTANDING. Upon arrival on the morning of the 22nd (10:30am) after a long flight from Philly (with a stopover in Houston) and after a long last few days of the week (we drove our son to college in NC from NJ and arrived home late Friday) we got our luggage and called the hotel for pick-up at the airport. The shuttle appeared very quickly and we were whisked to the hotel where we were told that they had set aside their best room (Room 103) so that we would not be disturbed by the trains since we would be there for five nights. We thanked them for that but we wanted a room where we could open the windows or have a balcony (only have a French balcony) so we waited for a different room (329). They stored our luggage and we went to lunch in Little Italy at a place called Fillipo's (okay food). We returned and our room was ready by 1:30. The hotel has a shuttle and they really only take you about three miles from the property but they were very accomodating and took us to/from the zoo (over three miles). All you really have to do is reserve the shuttle and they will take you or pick you up. I took the shuttle to the convention center each morning and they also took us to the Old Town Transit center a few times. The noise. Yes, there is noise but it's not what it is made out to be by some reviewers. The trolley comes by numerous times per day and the noise it makes is more like background noise. It's a bit noisier when the Amtrak train comes through but it's not something that would preclude you from staying there. Breakfast is very nice and the evening reception is welcome. Wednesday is a BBQ night where the manager (Jonathan) cooks and serves burgers and dogs. It's a friendly evening. The rooms were nice and clean although there should be more mirrors other than the one by the sink. Pool -- nice but the sun doesn't hit it much past 5:15. Overall, it was clean but it needed some TLC by the rim. Staff was quick to act when one of the children threw up after swallowing some water. The pool was closed, shocked and vacuumed. Smoking is a problem for those of us who don't smoke. Smoking is only allowed outside by the pool but the smoke seems to linger since there isn't much air circulation. The staff is friendly and goes out of its way to help. I would definitely recommedn this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again despite the train noise, standard Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: baseballfan53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights in a one bedroom suite. Rooms were the standard Residence inn style and comfort. As always they were clean and fine. Residence Inn is a perfect choice for families of 4 the pull out for the kids and bed for the adults is perfect. Train noise was noticeable but didn't wake me or my wife (who is a lighter sleeper) nor my children (1 & 3) but I would suggest a room at the side of the property (tracks at the back) to minimize the noise. Parking was hard to come by, which was a bit annoying since they charge $12 a day. Arrived late on first night and was told "there might not be a spot if not park in the handicap spot”, which we didn't have to do as there was one spot open. Would Marriot ensure I didn’t get a ticket? Unsure. Breakfast was a bit light and picked over if you didn’t get there early. Some Residence Inn’s restock until the end of advertised hours this one appears not to. Good spot for Sea World (10-15 min.) and Balboa park for a half marathon my wife ran.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was nice except the noise.”
Reviews.Author: circa1952
Reviews.Content: I really had an enjoyable stay at this hotel despite the noise. The staff is very nice. We had a two bedroom suite and it felt like an apartment instead of a hotel...very comfortable. The breakfasts were much nicer than you usually find. The problem is that there are two trains that run behind the hotel that are annoying until you get use to them. Also, the suite above us was occupied by a family with pre-teen children who liked to run and jump causing quiet a bit of noise in our unit. I would recommend that hotels put families with children of that age on the first floor. Ahh well, at least they were thoughtful enough to provide earplugs on the bedside table.

Reviews.Title: “Overall was ok”
Reviews.Author: PR_Refugee
Reviews.Content: Compared to other Residence, room were very small and I had a Jr Suite (two rooms). Rooms seem to be crammed with furniture. Their staff was excellent and very helpful. The first few days the train was a nouisance but after the third day I got used to it. Not enough parking available and $12 per day.... Recommended for business travel only.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for everything San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MORRELL_FAMILY
Reviews.Content: Residence Inns always seem to be our top pick for destinations because of their amenities and value. This location was no different. We were within walking distance to the waterfront and train station. We had a room on the top floor, facing the waterfront. The view of the waterfront was its best at night. We had read previous reviews of this location and were concerned about "train noise" as reported from other advisors. While we did hear some noise from our room - it was never enough to be "bothersome". In fact, when we stay in a different city - we welcome the neighboring noises that make each location unique. (I have to point out, however, we would have been disappointed to hear sirens or heavy street traffic. This was NEVER an issue at this location. When I say "never" - there was not one siren heard while we were in our room. Can you say that about other "downtown" location of any city hotels?) Breakfast (included), was plentiful and varied for each of the 4 mornings we were here. (They could stand to expand the seating area a little though. But, having said that - we were here in Feb and the temps were a little chilly in the a.m. - so morning breakfasts normally seated alfresco were a no go). Even with the chilly evenings, the heated pool was a welcome treat for our 6 year old who has never met a pool she hasn't liked. Tops on our list, for this location, was the shuttle service. With a little planning (calling ahead to make sure the bus was not previously occupied), we were able to get to Seaport Village, rental car offsite location, ferry marina, and airport without paying taxi fees. (Plus, the conversation from the drivers was always much more pleasant than that of the typical "cabbie"). Our room was perfectly appointed with updated furniture and decorations. Bath areas and sink area were always spotless. (Our housekeeper even left us a little treat for Valentines Day). We like to bring home with us when we travel so that our well-traveled daughter acclimates comfortably and we were pleased when her "things" were left exactly as she left them at the beginning of each day. (Yes, some hotels like to move your things where they think they should be and it always seems a little unsettling. It's little things like this that impress us). This location had a little courtyard surrounding the pool with lounge chairs and a fire pit. It was nice to see people gathering, in the evenings, to socialize in this area - even though it was a more adult age level than we thought appropriate for our daughter. All in all - a very nice experience in a very nice location in a very nice city. Kudos.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, despite the trains”
Reviews.Author: Tax_Counsel
Reviews.Content: Arriving the night before our seven-day Mexican cruise aboard the m/s Oosterdam (Holland America Line), we opted to spend that night at the Downtown San Diego Residence Inn. In contrast to some recent disappointments at other hotels, our stay at the Downtown San Diego Residence Inn was entirely pleasant. Our room was clean. The front desk clerk, Michael, was friendly, as was the breakfast staff—who earned a well-deserved tip for the kindness they displayed to my two young daughters. This hotel’s on-site shuttle and free high-speed internet access (“HISA”) were especially helpful. The shuttle picked me up from our car rental location and also transported my family (and our six pieces of luggage and our child’s stroller) to the cruise ship terminal. Free HISA allowed me to get some last-minute work finished before our cruise ship sailed away. Our only concern arises from the hotel’s location—it’s near both the waterfront traffic and San Diego train station. The train horns start sounding around 7 am, as does the traffic noise level. Rooms facing the bay will be less affected by the train horns. Despite these (incurable) problems we liked the place and would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “There are definitely trade offs”
Reviews.Author: MAXIALE
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reading the reviews here. I knew about the train and was prepared to deal with a few passings. I guess seeing the ear plugs on the bedside table set me up to expect the worse. I remember reading that the trains stopped in the night. I didn't think that. I remember hearing trains passing as late as 11pm. My husband, my 5 year old and I rented a studio suite and were for the most part happy with the set up. The color scheme was fresh looking and we had an ocean view opposite of the train tracks. The best part was that we arrived early and called the hotel and they let us check in early. This was even during the labor day weekend. Upon entering the room my husband was really impressed ( i think it was the blue and yellow color scheme). I liked the set up of the kitchenette along with the pull out sofa, desk and chair. There was also a double door that lead to a "balcony". I use that word loosely because I would not feel safe standing out there on the iron railing. But having the door open with the ocean breeze blowing in was a long forgotten fairytale. Now the problems....I couldn't get the feeling that I was in a really olddd place with a new paint job out of my mine. I felt as if the room was screaming at me to please like it. I could see chips and cracks and bad patches peeking throught the vibrant blue and yellow paint. The bathroom was sanitary but the walls seemed slightly discolored. The pull out sofa seemed dingy to me and left me wandering who sat there the night before. So much that I really didn't want to sit on it. After pulling it out and putting on fresh clean sheets that thought left my mind. The kitchen and dishes were clean and I would've had no problem using them. Sleeping at night was pretty bad for me. The bed was way too hard for my comfort which is probably why i was so sensitive to the train at 11pm. I asked my husband about it and he said he liked the bed. 'Upon waking,we had breakfast which was pretty hotel standard (and great) and then we walked the boardwalk and really enjoyed our time including the USS Midway. While walking the boardwalk I was contemplating what ifs....what if we stayed at a different hotel downtown? We'd still have the same problem with the trains and the airplanes so it was not the Marriotts fault. The downtown place is a great place to stay for night owls and partyers. There were people hanging out on balconys on other hotels as well that night. I could not bare the thought of spending another night at that location so we checked out and stayed at a different hotel further inland. I stayed at a Homewood Suites 2 weeks prior and have decided that this will be my hotel of choice at this point.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: profesora72
Reviews.Content: This is a true jewel! I stayed here for 2 nights and it was wonderful. I stayed in a two bed, two bath full kitchen unit. It felt like I was at home. My two boys loved it too. All rooms have a TV and so does the living room. There is complimentary breakfast and a snack in the afternoon. All staff are friendly, and check-in is super fast. The rooms are meticulously clean. I will stay here again next summer. I definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Trains, Trains, Trains”
Reviews.Author: lindacote
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights at the Residence Inn, Marriott Downtown, after a beautiful cruise. We did not know this hotel, nor saw any reviews from hotel or on web sites - therefore as we have stayed at Residence Inn's by Marriott before and enjoyed the stay, we assumed it would be a nice hotel in a good location, no need for a car. We had never been to San Diego downtown and did not know about the big train station that seemed to service a lot of trains - Amtrak, commuter, tourist trolley and cargo trains - at all times, night and day. The ear plugs left beside the bed didn't really give us a clue - it was a while later and during the night - the train whistles and whatever - it was so loud and the windows were closed! We were supposedly in a quiet section of the hotel and it was right beside the train tracks! The 3:55 AM noise of whistles and rattling of box cars that got the best of me. Although I eventually did laugh, for the price of the room - we would not have stayed in such a noisy hotel. Everything about the hotel was really nice EXCEPT the noisy trains, trains, trains.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Boysie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks on vacation from Scotland at the end of September and were made very welcome. We had a 1 bed apt which was very clean, well maintained with furnishings showing no wear or tear.It had everything you could possibly need in the mini kitchen to make an evening meal if you wished. Monday to Thursday the hotel provides a complimentary light meal arround the pool area between 5 and 7. This changed nightly and included hamburgers with salads--or pasta --tacos---baked potatoes all served by an extremely aimiable bunch of staff. Free wine, beer and sodas and the chance to mingle with other guests made it something to look forward to. The breakfasts too were very good--self service for quickness as many of the guests during the week are on business. Good self service laundry. Just one downside--The hotel backs on to the railway track--it is prettywell in the centre of town--so there is some earymorning noise from the trains. The Coaster and the Amtrack start blowing their horns from about 5.30 so bring earplugs if you think it will annoy you, and request a room away from the track when booking. All the other guests I spoke to were happy with the hotel, it had a very homely feel about it and the staff were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCook
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were traveling to Chula Vista for a dog show and had more than one dog with us, as well as two teenagers (my son and my daughter). We needed to stay at a hotel which accepts pets and was close to Chula Vista - without being in Tijuana. Through the hotel's website, I booked a two bedroom suite (one room for the adults, one for the daughter, and one for the son with dogs in one room). I could've done two rooms next to each other but the teenagers don't want to share a room, much less a bed. After a late arrival - we got started driving late - I was greeted by "we were overbooked and sold out of two bedroom suites." This meant the boys took one room and the girls another, not a totally acceptable choice but on a Friday night in the San Diego area with pets you've either booked ahead or you sleep on the beach.. The rooms are actually quite clean and well appointed, with each having a dining area, full (ish) kitchen, and a queen size bed and pullout couch. Be warned, however! They provide ear plugs for a reason. You cannot get closer to the railroad tracks without getting run over, and it's not just city trains or cross-country trains, it's both. There's only so much you can do to block out every-few-minuts train noise and horns. The next day, we were moved to the suite (not the most convenient activity but better than the arrangement we had). The suite was equally clean with the same decor. There were two queen beds and a pullout in the common room, which was again outfitted with full kitchen. Earplugs had to be retrieved this time from the front desk - facing away from the trains and towards the bay did not help much. The bathrooms were decent sized but the vanity in one room was large enough for two sinks (though it contained only one) and the other vanity was barely wide enough for one person (though the room had more closet space). Showers were effective and shower heads were high enough (I'm 6'1" and they usually clean my chest but not my head without ducking down). Towels were smallish but still a little soft. The complimentary breakfast buffet was not the usual carbo-only feast, featuring not only the usual doughnut/bagel/bread/ceral choices (add pancakes to the carb side of the equation) but also had sausage patties and eggs. These were, unfortunately, almost inedible. The sausage was peppery, a little greasy, and (odd for ground meat) tough. The eggs were so over cooked it was like eating rubbery rice. I didn't try the coffee (Starbuck's was right around the corner). The toaster was a commercial run-through which is convenient, but was set to a speed that gave only a slight warming once through. There was a couple kinds of yogurt and some fresh fruit (apples, bananas, oranges) as well. I would stay here again, though the prices were a little high, because it's close to SeaWorld and to our dog show, but I'd make it perfectly clear on the phone with them that I have specific reasons for booking the suite, not just because I want a big room, and that if their reservation center is going to overbook I would be very appreciative of them not giving away my room. The staff were mostly professional and took my tired-from-driving abuse without taking it personally.

Reviews.Title: “okay”
Reviews.Author: DawnNoelm
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our 4 children, ages 10, 13, 15 and 16. We had the 2 bedroom with a living room area. I think this hotel is best for those with small children. The seating in the kitchen "area" was only for four, and the couch/love seat held 2 and there was one chair. The hotel is ON the train tracks. We were in room 201 in the back of the hotel - although the front would be right on a busy street you might be best off asking for a room on that side - because we were kept up all night by the train. They give you ear plugs in your room. NEVER a good sign. The front desk was just "okay" - when I asked if they had local movie listing - they refered me to the computer and it was not "free". Most front desks will assist you with this information. The location was also just "okay". It is definately NOT downtown - closer to the airport. The breakfasts were good - they were better then most that include breakfast in the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great location”
Reviews.Author: travellingfood
Reviews.Content: I am very picky about hotels. This hotel is a fabulous hotel in a great location. It starts when you check-in and the staff is the best you will find, they were professional and incredibly friendly, down to the housekeeping staff who always had a friendly hello when passing. Rooms are very nicely done with elegant and tasteful decor. It is very very clean! Weekend breakfast if fine, waffles, pancakes,eggs etc...it is free, not gourmet. You do hear overhead noise from airplanes as you are close to the airport and the train that runs directly behind the hotel. This is not a "rest by the pool" type of hotel, this is a great business hotel or base for sightseeing, if you want to rest by a pool I would suggest one of the beach resorts. You cannot go wrong for the price, I find it to be a great value in a expensive city, if you choose a hotel more central in the very dowtown area you will pay significantly more money. I was able to walk to the Seaport Village area along the Marina and I am an out of shape 40 something year old woman. Just a short two blocks up behind the hotel is Little Italy with fabulous dining and boutique shops. The area felt very safe. Tip: There is a 7 eleven store a half of block behind the Jack in the Box , stop in and buy your soda and snacks, it will save you money in the long run, the soda and snacks in the little market of the hotel are expensive. Fabulous hotel..love it.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel and Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: JBinWV
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at this terrific hotel (Feb22-25). Once we arrived at the airport I called the hotel and they sent a shuttle to pick us up within 10 minutes. When checking in they upgraded us to a 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom suite which also had a full kithen. Each bedroom had a tv along with the living room. This was a plus since we had two children (7 and 13). I can't say enough good things about the staff members at this hotel. They were all so nice and helpful and the shuttle van drivers gave us excellent advice while taking us to various destinations around town (within 3 miles of hotel). The breakfasts served each morning were much more than we expected. Scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, fruit, cereal and much more! The pool area was very nice as well. The kids were able to enjoy some swimming in the evenings since the pool was heated. There was also a jacuzzi which my wife and I enjoyed. Little Italy is just a few blocks behind the hotel. I would definitely recommend eating at Filippi's at leat once. The hotel is not right on the bay but is just a short walk away. Seaport Village is about a 10-15 minute walk away. The Convention Center is about a 20 minute walk from the hotel (just past SP Village) but was not a big deal to me since I only had to walk there a couple of times to attend meetings. There is so much to do and see in San Diego. If you have plans to visit the city, this is a GREAT hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but not really in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Craig D
Reviews.Content: I was there 3 nights for a convention. The meeting had contracted with 6 hotels in the area, but I was late registering and the Residence Inn was the only one left. After staying there, I imagine the main reason is that it was the farthest hotel away from the Convention Center. Another reason to think twice about staying here is that train tracks run nearby and all trains blow the whistle as they pass by. At the airport, I called and requested the free shuttle van, which came promptly. The van will take guests anywhere within a few miles, so I signed up a couple of times to get back and forth to the Convention Center. The first time I walked there and back, which took 20 minutes moving briskly. As the weather was great, it was an enjoyable long walk but not if you're dressed up or carrying a briefcase or laptop. Walking back at night was ok - I went through the Gaslamp shopping/restaurant district. Lots of people and I wasn't nervous walking on the busy streets. The hotel has a nice food area in the lobby. I ate there one evening which featured free beer, wine, and soft drinks and make-your-own burritos and tacos. If I remember correctly, the free "dinner" is only M-Th. The daily breakfast buffet had plenty of choices including eggs, meat, fruit, cereal, yogurt, etc. A fitness room had several cardio machines and weight machines but nothing fancy. I didn't visit the pool but it looked fine. I was upgraded to a suite because I arrived early and none of the regular rooms were ready. I don't know what it cost normally, but it was large enough for a family on vacation. It had a full-size fridge, stove, microwave, and dishes/silverware. Nothing to complain about in the room, but location, location, location - always ask for a room away from the railroad tracks. There are free earplugs on the nightstand, which should tell you something. It's a short walk to the harbor with the large ships on display. There are a few fast-food places nearby but I recommend walking up the hill to Little Italy, for better restaurants. I ate at Filipi's, which had great food and a little grocery store with hard-to-find Italian foods. This was my first trip to San Diego. I'll probably choose a different hotel if I return - something closer to downtown and the Convention Center - but the Residence Inn is certainly a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Too much cash for too little”
Reviews.Author: OTBS32
Reviews.Content: The hotel had a "snack" in the evening. They call it a snack so as not to disappoint those looking for a meal. The food was pretty good however they closed the food down early so if you plan to eat there be there on time. They do tear down the food (in our case 10 minutes) early. The staff did not all understand English which made it difficult to get what was needed. Breakfast was pretty good for a hotel breakfast feeding that many people. However they kept running out of things like milk. The bed was difficult to sleep in because my wife and I both rolled in the center due to a bad mattress

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: memberat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the second year in a row and must say it has even gotten better. Newly remodeled room was a plus, in bright, cheerful colors; nevermind typical bland hotel decor. For us, location can't be beat, downtown, close to it all, Seaworld, shopping, beaches. It really is a vibrant area. Can't say enough about front desk staff, very wonderful and helpful. Breakfast offers a nice selection. Will definetely continue to stay here on return visits to San Diego.

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn San Diego Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 1747 Pacific Highway, San Diego, CA 92101
